case_title: SOUDAMINI ROY MALAKAR vs NARENDRA CHANDRA BARMAN And Another
case_number: Appeal from Original Decree No. 104 of 1943

case_summary.property_involved: C. S. Plots 1933 and 1934 of the town of Mymensingh with buildings and structures
case_summary.plaintiff_claim: 3 annas, 6 gandas, 2 karas, 2 krantis share based on Exh. 4 (deed of sale dated 1940-09-12)
case_summary.dispute_summary: Partition dispute among heirs and transferees of the property.

appellant_arguments: Presumption of correctness of record-of-rights entry not given due weight.
Exh. C-1 executed by Hemlata is void due to fraud and lack of legal authority.
Hemlata lost her rights to property and guardianship after remarriage.
respondent_arguments: Exh. C-1 was validly executed with proper advice.
Hemlata retained property rights due to caste custom allowing remarriage.

court_findings.exh_a1: Voluntarily executed by Kumudini in favor of Lakshikanta.
court_findings.exh_c1: Valid conveyance executed by Hemlata with proper advice and consideration.
court_findings.record_of_rights: Entry showing Satish's share as 3 annas and odd is presumed correct.
court_findings.hindu_widows_remarriage_act: Hemlata forfeited her rights to Satish's property upon remarriage but retained guardianship of Kamala.

judgment_details.partition_decree: Preliminary decree for partition granted for 3 annas and odd share minus 8 gandas and odd share conveyed under Exh. C-1.
judgment_details.commissioner_appointment: Commissioner to effect partition by metes and bounds.
judgment_details.costs: Contestant respondents to pay proportionate costs to appellant.
